Cheremkhovo (Russian: Черемхо́во: Within the framework of administrative divisions
IPA: [tɕɪrʲɪmˈxovə]) is a town in Irkut: Cheremkhovo serves as the administrative center of Cheremkhovsky District
Russia: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
it is incorporated separately as the Town of Cheremkhovo—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
647 (2010 Census); 60: the Town of Cheremkhovo is incorporated as Cheremkhovo Urban Okrug.
